org.itemscript.core.values
Interface JsonArray

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<JsonValue>, HasSystem, java.lang.Iterable<JsonValue>, JsonContainer, JsonGetAccess, JsonValue, java.util.List<JsonValue>
All Known Implementing Classes:
WeakArray
public interface JsonArray
extends JsonContainer, java.util.List<JsonValue>

Represents a JSON array value.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

a

JsonArray a(java.lang.Boolean value)
Add a boolean value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array.

Parameters:
value - The boolean value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

a

JsonArray a(byte[] value)
Add a binary value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
value - The binary value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

Returns:
This JsonArray object.

a

JsonArray a(java.lang.Long value)
Add a long value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array. Note that because JSON numbers cannot safely contain a long value, longs are stored in JSON string values.

Parameters:
value - The long value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

Add a string value to this array, returning this JsonArray. This method can be used for inline initialization of an array.

Parameters:
value - The String value to be added.
Returns:
This JsonArray object.

add

void add(byte[] value)
Add a binary value to this array.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
value - The binary value to add.

getArray

JsonArray getArray(int index)
Get a JsonArray from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The JsonArray at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonArray.

getBinary

byte[] getBinary(int index)
Get a binary value from this array as a byte[].

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The byte[] value of the JsonString at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonString.
Throws:
ItemscriptError - If there is a JsonString at that index, but it cannot be parsed as a base-64-encoded binary value.

getBoolean

java.lang.Boolean getBoolean(int index)
Get a boolean value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The boolean value of the JsonBoolean at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonBoolean.

getDouble

java.lang.Double getDouble(int index)
Get a double value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The double value of the JsonNumber at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonNumber.

getFloat

java.lang.Float getFloat(int index)
Get a float value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The float value of the JsonNumber at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonNumber.

getInt

java.lang.Integer getInt(int index)
Get an integer value from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The int value of the JsonNumber at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonNumber.

getLong

java.lang.Long getLong(int index)
Get a long value from this array. Note that because JSON numbers cannot safely contain a long value, longs are stored in JSON string values. If the value does not exist or is not a string, returns null. If the value is a string but it cannot be parsed as a long, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The long value of the JsonString at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonString.

getObject

JsonObject getObject(int index)
Get a JsonObject from this array.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The JsonObject value at that index, or null if there was no value there or it was not a JsonObject.

getOrCreateArray

JsonArray getOrCreateArray(int index)
Get a JsonArray from this JsonArray, creating it if the value did not exist. If the value already existed but was not an array, an error will be thrown.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The existing or newly-created JsonArray.

getOrCreateObject

JsonObject getOrCreateObject(int index)
Get a JsonObject from this container, creating it if the value did not exist. If the value already existed but was not an object, an error will be thrown.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The existing or newly-created JsonObject.

getRequiredArray

JsonArray getRequiredArray(int index)
Get a JsonArray from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonArray, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The JsonArray under that index.

getRequiredBinary

byte[] getRequiredBinary(int index)
Get a binary value from this JsonArray as a byte[]. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonString, or is a JsonString but cannot be parsed as a base64 value, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The binary value of the JsonString under that index.

getRequiredBoolean

java.lang.Boolean getRequiredBoolean(int index)
Get a Boolean from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonBoolean, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The Boolean value of the JsonBoolean under that index.

java.lang.Double getRequiredDouble(int index)
Get a Double from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonNumber, throws an exception.

index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The Double value of the JsonNumber under that index.

getRequiredInt

java.lang.Integer getRequiredInt(int index)
Get an Integer from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonNumber, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The Integer value of the JsonNumber under that index.

getRequiredLong

java.lang.Long getRequiredLong(int index)
Get a Long from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonString, throws an exception. If the value is a JsonString, but it cannot be converted to a Long value, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The Long value of the JsonString under that index.

getRequiredObject

JsonObject getRequiredObject(int index)
Get a JsonObject from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonObject, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The JsonObject value under that index.

getRequiredString

java.lang.String getRequiredString(int index)
Get a string from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonString, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value..
Returns:
The String value of the JsonString under that index.

getRequiredValue

JsonValue getRequiredValue(int index)
Get a value from this JsonArray. If the value does not exist, throws an exception.

Parameters:
index - The index of the value.
Returns:
The value under that index.

set

void set(int index,
         byte[] value)
Set a binary value at the given index.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
index - The index to set at.
value - The binary value to set.
